meanings.definition: A photograph or film shot taken at very close range.
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the director used a closeup of the actor's face to show his emotions.
meanings.sent2: The photographer captured a closeup of the flower petals, highlighting their delicate beauty.
meanings.sent3: During the family photo session, the closeup of the baby's tiny toes made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The closeup of the bee on the flower revealed intricate details not visible from afar.
meanings.sent5: The closeup of the spider's web glistened with dew, creating a mesmerizing image.

meanings.definition: A detailed or intimate view or examination.
meanings.sent1: The detective took a closeup look at the evidence to find any clues.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the closeup of the painting, noticing every brushstroke and color.
meanings.sent3: The closeup of the cake's frosting revealed a hidden message written in icing.
meanings.sent4: His closeup of the map helped him navigate through the intricate maze of streets.
meanings.sent5: The closeup of the old book's pages showed handwritten notes in the margins.
